events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their vehicle with another car on the highway during rush hour.
Upon review of the initial report, the claim was categorised under auto accident due to mention of vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was promptly assigned to manage the case and assist the claimant with next steps.
The claim was formally acknowledged and confirmation sent to the insured customer via email.
The insurer requested supporting documents including police report, photos of vehicle damage, and driver’s license.
The claimant submitted all requested documents in a timely manner, including detailed photos and accident report.
The investigation team began examining the submitted evidence to verify the circumstances of the accident.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the insured was not at fault in the accident.
A fair settlement amount was offered to cover vehicle repair costs and related expenses.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the speed and transparency of the claims process.
Following customer agreement, the claim was officially approved for settlement disbursement.
The settlement payment was processed and issued to the claimant’s bank account without delay.
The claim file was closed after confirmation that all issues were resolved and payment received.
The completed claim documentation and correspondence were securely archived following closure.
